text: @Dingo_Kayfabe @MenoDolce @GayeStepdad No doubt it sounds shitty as all get out to hear but one of the most important things is to keep pointing out the fucked up stuff going on. It’s never gonna sound nice. And one isn’t required to form solutions in order to criticize
@Dingo_Kayfabe @MenoDolce @GayeStepdad Bc if u say so. Then it is
@moose34735572 @MenoDolce @GayeStepdad They’re not the same, but what Aimee does is definitely talking shit, does that clear things up for you?
@Dingo_Kayfabe @MenoDolce @GayeStepdad Lol I guess if talking shit= criticism in your mind then 👌ok😘 keep with it🙄

@moose34735572 @MenoDolce @GayeStepdad Seems to me like talking shit without actually offering solutions is just a way to cheerlead the status quo. If you like the status quo, then I guess you’d like Aimee.

@MenoDolce @GayeStepdad I kinda get that but there’s something deeply flawed about thinking someone oughta offer up solutions if they’re critique what’s going on. To say plainly what’s happening is about as much as 1can do https://t.co/XclYh335gP real changeoccuring electorally/via policy

@GayeStepdad I too find it grim but she’s so extreme in her critique, without offering a real alternative to right-wing Thatcherism, that I’m beginning to find her commentary redundant and ultimately fruitless.

@MenoDolce Maybe the state of the left and emancipatory politics in general is so grim that hearing someone soberly assess its current state and prospects is tiring, and therefore sounds "tiresome"? I think this could be why!

@GayeStepdad Not familiar with Chapo but I find it hard to find Aimee’s critiques “emancipatory intellectual inquiry” when it’s nothing but “all leftism is bourgeois and bad.” She absolves herself from making policy suggestions because she “doesn’t have to” and it’s getting tiresome.

Ask yourself why Aimee Terese has never been invited on Chapo. It's because her analyses implicate Chapo as being a media project that uses custom-tailored politics that are big-media-project-friendly. Chapo could never do emancipatory intellectual inquiry and become millionaires
